title: Suddenlink Communications and Riot Peering Partners
body:
I recently found out that Suddenlink Communications is not Peering Partners with Riot Games. This for me finally helps me understand why my ping was 115 since September and is now 135+ every game.
How many players out there also have poor ping due to them having Suddenlink?
How many players, such as myself and my friends, have the inability to switch networks because Suddenlink has a monopoly?
Is there a way to get Suddenlink to become Peering Partners with Riot, or vice versa?
Sorry if this is in the wrong thread.
Thanks

replies.body:
I don't have a lot of visibility on ISPs, but we have an open[ Peering Policy ](http://www.riotgames.com/peering-policy)willing to work things out with them.  ISP can reach out to participate, but it's not really something I'm able to push through or make happen.  

All that said, are you absolutely sure that the increase in ping is a result of how your ISP is routing to us?  There could be other local issues that may be straining your network.  I suggest using our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide just to be sure!  I hope it helps!

I did a run through of that before posting this. Do you have any info on how I can reach out to my ISP to get them to consider becoming Peering Partners?
It could be an increase in users on the network, but my upload and download speed still seem fine. Ping to elsewhere is excellent.  But Ping in league is 135+ and makes the game un-fun and in my mind unplayable.
